title: chat: use language model metadata when restoring persisted default model (fixes included models fallback)
body:
Fixes [#262698](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/262698)

Summary:
Remove hard-coded `'copilot/gpt-4.1'` special-case when restoring the persisted selected model in the Copilot chat input. The code now looks up the persisted model metadata and uses `isDefault` to determine whether the persisted selection was the default at the time of storing.

Files changed:
- `src/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/browser/chatInputPart.ts`

Problem:
Stable builds were restoring only `copilot/gpt-4.1` as the fallback default model due to a literal string check (`persistedSelection === 'copilot/gpt-4.1'`). This prevented other included (0x) models from being restored/selected as fallback.

Change:
- Lookup the persisted model via `languageModelsService.lookupLanguageModel(...)`.
- When reading the `.isDefault` storage fallback, use the model's metadata: `persistedModel?.isDefault ?? false`.
- Preserve the existing restore logic but avoid the `copilot/gpt-4.1` hard-coded special-case.

Testing / notes:
- Local TypeScript compile check (`npm run tsec-compile-check`) completed with no errors in my environment.
- I did not run the full product compile locally (_heavy_). CI should run the full build/test matrix and catch any further issues.
- This change should be low-risk; it removes **a single** hard-coded special case and **uses existing model metadata**.

Follow-ups:
- If CI flags anything, I will iterate on the PR.
- Consider adding a small unit test for the persisted default logic if there's a unit-test surface available for `ChatInputPart` or the model restoration logic.

Reviewer notes:
- Relevant issue: [#262698](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/262698)

title: Distinguish variables and functions colours in Solarized Light/Dark themes
body: I’ve been using the built-in **Solarized Light** and **Solarized Dark** themes in **VS Code**, and while they’re great overall, I think they could be improved for **readability** and **clarity**. Right now, **variables** and **functions/methods** are in a **same colour**, which makes it harder to visually separate them in code. Giving them distinct but **harmonious colours** would make the themes much more **desirable** and **developer-friendly**, while still staying **faithful to the Solarized palette**. 🔴 Current theme – variables and functions look the same: 🟢 Proposed improvement – clearer separation between variables and functions: 🔴 Current theme – again, variables and functions share the same colour: 🟢 Proposed improvement – improved readability with distinct colours:

- VS Code Version: 1.103.0
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to .vscode/settings.json file or Open Settings UI
2. write this setting in json
```
"git.ignoredRepositories": [
  "C:/Projects/legacy-repo",
  "C:\\Projects\\experimental-repo\\"
]
```
or add item `C:/Projects/legacy-repo` in UI.   
You can also add it like `C:\\Projects\\legacy-repo\\` adding backslashes to the end.  
3. Reload the window
4. The repos are still there, they are not ignored.
5. Change the setting and write it with double backslashes, without adding it to the end. i.e:
```  
"git.ignoredRepositories": [
  "C:\\Projects\\legacy-repo",
  "C:\\Projects\\experimental-repo"
]
```
or add item in UI similarly like `C:\\Projects\\experimental-repo`
6. This time you will see they are ignored. The setting works.

title: Only GPT-4.1 available as fallback included model for GitHub Pro users after premium quota is exhausted (stable release)
body: ## Bug Summary When a GitHub Pro user exhausts their premium Copilot requests (_quota_), only **GPT-4.1** is available as the fallback 'included' (_0x_) model in VSCode stable. Other included models (_e.g. GPT-5 Mini, GPT-4o, etc._) are not usable, despite being available in Insiders builds. This prevents users from switching to other included models as _intended_. ## Steps to Reproduce 1. Ensure you are a GitHub Pro user and have used up your monthly premium Copilot quota (_300 requests/month_). 2. Open VSCode stable (_not Insiders_). 3. Try to select a different included (_0x_) model in Copilot chat (_e.g. GPT-5 Mini (Preview), GPT-4o or GPT-4o Mini, etc._). ## Expected Behavior - All included models (_0x_) should be available for selection as fallback after premium quota is exhausted. ## Actual Behavior - Only GPT-4.1 is available and shown in the model picker. - Other included models are unusable. Error thrown: ## Root Cause (Code Reference) - In `src/vs/workbench/contrib/chat/browser/chatInputPart.ts`, the code checks if the persisted selection is `'copilot/gpt-4.1'` when restoring the default model: ```typescript const persistedAsDefault = this.storageService.getBoolean(this.getSelectedModelIsDefaultStorageKey(), StorageScope.APPLICATION, persistedSelection === 'copilot/gpt-4.1'); ``` - This hard-coded check blocks any other included model from being restored as default, _even_ if it should be. ## Fix Proposal - Remove the hard-coded `'copilot/gpt-4.1'` special-case and generalize default detection to use the model's metadata (_`isDefault`_). - Ensure all fallback/included models have `isDefault: true` or `isUserSelectable: true` as appropriate. **Suggested code fix:** ```typescript const model = this.languageModelsService.lookupLanguageModel(persistedSelection); const persistedAsDefault = this.storageService.getBoolean(this.getSelectedModelIsDefaultStorageKey(), StorageScope.APPLICATION, model?.isDefault ?? false); ``` ## Additional Info - This bug is **NOT** present in Insiders builds (_all included models are available there_). - Product configuration differences (_`trustedExtensionAuthAccess`_) may also affect stable/insiders, but the code needs to be robust anyways. - This is not an issue with Github, you can access other 0x models in **VS Code Insiders**, **Zed editor**, or **Neovim** --- - VS Code Version: 1.103.1 (Universal), Commit: 360a4e4fd251bfce169a4ddf857c7d25d1ad40da Date: 2025-08-12T16:25:40.542Z (1 wk ago) - Copilot Chat Extension Version: 0.30.1 - OS Version: macOS 15.6 (24G84) - Feature: Copilot Chat model picker - Selected model: Only GPT-4.1 available after quota

title: Code folding is broken recently

labels.name: info-needed

body:
Type: Bug Code folding for JavaScript in particular appears to be seriously broken. This has happened over the last few releases. I have created a new profile to test this, it has no settings or extensions so just uses the default VS Code settings. Most notably, a JavaScript `if` statement with an `else`, the else section is no longer foldable and the if section, if folded leaves the content of the else showing along with the final closing brace. Exhaust your premium Github Copilot usage (300 per month, on the Pro account), now you can only use regular (0x) models 2. We have automatically switched you to GPT-4.1 which is included with your plan. Enable additional paid premium requests to continue using premium models." Github Copilot has documentation that explains when you exhaust your premium model usage in a month (on the Pro account, the 300 requests), you can only access the 0x models called "included models". title: Update for-in loop snippet with `Object.hasOwn()`
body:
<!-- Thank you for submitting a Pull Request. Please:
* Read our Pull Request guidelines:
  https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/How-to-Contribute#pull-requests
* Associate an issue with the Pull Request.
* Ensure that the code is up-to-date with the `main` branch.
* Include a description of the proposed changes and how to test them.
-->
Cleaner change for the For-In Loop snippets. With an early continue for 1 less indent & does not trigger [ESLint no-prototype-builtins](https://eslint.org/docs/latest/rules/no-prototype-builtins)

I used `Object.hasOwn(${2:object}, ${1:key})` over `${2:object}.hasOwn(${1:key})` because the latter only showed "any" in the hover poup while the former gives the method's  documentation from the `ObjectConstructor` typescript interface.

Closes #262678

title: Update For-In Loop snippet to use `Object.hasOwn()`

labels.name: verified
labels.description: Verification succeeded

labels.name: verification-needed
labels.description: Verification of issue is requested

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
Update the snippet for the For-In loop to replace the call to `Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call()` to its replacement: [Object.hasOwn() (MDN)](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/hasOwn)

**Why:**
On MDN it states:
> **Note:** `Object.hasOwn()` is intended as a replacement for `Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty()`.

> It is recommended over `Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty()` because it works for [null-prototype objects](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object#null-prototype_objects) and with objects that have overridden the inherited `hasOwnProperty()` method. While it is possible to workaround these problems by accessing `Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty()` on another object (like `Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call(obj, prop)`, `Object.hasOwn()` is more intuitive and concise.

See [Problematic cases for hasOwnProperty() (MDN)](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/hasOwn#problematic_cases_for_hasownproperty)

The browser support is nearing 4 years next month for most browsers, except Safari/Samsung Internet/iOS WebView which are around 3.5 years support.

It's shorter and easier to read. And seeing this call used makes it easier for developers to learn which method to use when they need to use it outside the snippet. (I keep having to search which the proper way was again quite a few times)

Using `hasOwn()` also doesn't trigger the eslint "no-prototype-builtins" rule. Which is what made #219917 & #99721 change it to this, frankly hideous, prototype call. See this [ESLint Playground](https://eslint.org/play/#)

title: Fix inconsistent scroll speed between editor and SCM diff view
body:
The scrolling speed in the SCM commit diff view was inconsistent with the editor's scrolling speed, creating a jarring user experience when switching between these components.

## Problem

The multi-diff editor used in SCM commit diff views was creating its own `SmoothScrollableElement` without applying the user's configured scroll sensitivity settings. While the regular editor properly respected settings like `editor.mouseWheelScrollSensitivity` and `editor.fastScrollSensitivity`, the diff view ignored these preferences and used hardcoded defaults.

## Solution

Modified `MultiDiffEditorWidgetImpl` to:

1. **Read scroll configuration**: Extract scroll sensitivity settings from the configuration service with proper defaults:
   - `editor.mouseWheelScrollSensitivity` (default: 1.0)
   - `editor.fastScrollSensitivity` (default: 5.0) 
   - `editor.scrollPredominantAxis` (default: true)

2. **Apply settings consistently**: Pass these values to the `SmoothScrollableElement` constructor, matching the behavior of the regular editor's `EditorScrollbar`

3. **Support real-time updates**: Listen for configuration changes and update scroll options dynamically when users modify their scroll preferences

## Technical Details

The fix involves injecting `IConfigurationService` into the multi-diff editor and using the same configuration extraction pattern as the regular editor scrollbar. This ensures both components respect the user's scroll sensitivity preferences consistently.

```typescript
// Extract user's scroll preferences
const mouseWheelScrollSensitivity = this._configurationService.getValue<number>('editor.mouseWheelScrollSensitivity') ?? 1;
const fastScrollSensitivity = this._configurationService.getValue<number>('editor.fastScrollSensitivity') ?? 5;
const scrollPredominantAxis = this._configurationService.getValue<boolean>('editor.scrollPredominantAxis') ?? true;

// Apply to scrollable element
this._scrollableElement = this._register(new SmoothScrollableElement(this._scrollableElements.root, {
    vertical: ScrollbarVisibility.Auto,
    horizontal: ScrollbarVisibility.Auto,
    useShadows: false,
    mouseWheelScrollSensitivity,
    fastScrollSensitivity,
    scrollPredominantAxis,
}, this._scrollable));
```

After this change, users will experience consistent scroll behavior across all editor components, and scroll speed customizations will apply uniformly throughout the application.

Fixes #261443.

title: Copilot Chat 0.30.1 fails in SAP BAS (OpenVSCode 1.103.1): CORS limited_user_signup preflight 404 + proposed API gating
body: I’m attempting to run the GitHub Copilot Chat extension from a fork on OpenVSCode (SAP Business Application Studio). I can install and surface the UI, but I hit two categories of blockers: - Signup/entitlement flow fails with CORS (limited_user_signup preflight 404) from BAS/OpenVSCode web origins. - Extension initialization fails because required VS Code “proposed APIs” aren’t exposed in OpenVSCode/BAS, causing tool registration to fail and chat features to be non-functional. **Important setup detail** (OpenVSCode product.json) To progress past the initial sign-in stage, I modified OpenVSCode’s product.json to add a default chat agent: { "defaultChatAgent": { "extensionId": "github.copilot", "chatExtensionId": "github.copilot-chat", ... } } Without this, trying to sign in to GitHub errors earlier because IChatEntitlementService is undefined in this environment. With defaultChatAgent set, the sign-in UI proceeds, but the flow later fails with CORS and the extension still cannot register required proposed APIs. **What I did** 1) Installed Copilot Chat from VSIX (0.30.1) into OpenVSCode 1.103.1. - I also tested copilot-chat 0.29.1 with openvscode 1.102.2; same behavior. 2) Added "defaultChatAgent" to product.json so that GitHub sign-in UI works (otherwise I hit IChatEntitlementService undefined). 3) Opened the Copilot Chat view and attempted to sign up for/use the “Copilot Free plan.” 4) Observed network and console errors below; chat tools fail to register. **What I expected** - Sign-up/entitlement to succeed from BAS. - Extension to initialize, register language model tools/menus, and function. **What actually happens** A) CORS/Signup failure from BAS origin - Network tab shows limited_user_signup preflight failing: - Request: OPTIONS https://…/limited_user_signup (or equivalent Copilot signup endpoint) - Status: 404 on preflight; CORS error in fetch; - In console: - Access to fetch at 'https://api.github.com/copilot_internal/v2/entitlements' from origin 'https://theia-workspaces-ws-s6u54.cry10.int.applicationstudio.cloud.sap' has been blocked by CORS policy: Response to preflight request doesn't pass access control check: It does not have HTTP ok status.Understand this error - GET https://api.github.com/copilot_internal/v2/entitlements net::ERR_FAILED - This suggests the Copilot backend does not allowlist BAS/OpenVSCode origins for this flow. B) Proposed API gating in OpenVSCode/BAS (tools don’t register) Representative console errors (snippets): - ERR Extension 'github.copilot-chat' wants API proposal 'findFiles2@2' but that proposal DOES NOT EXIST. - ERR Extension 'github.copilot-chat' wants API proposal 'defaultChatParticipant@4' but that proposal DOES NOT EXIST. - ERR Extension 'github.copilot-chat' wants API proposal 'aiTextSearchProvider@2' but that proposal DOES NOT EXIST. - ERR Extension 'github.copilot-chat' wants API proposal 'chatParticipantPrivate@9' but that proposal DOES NOT EXIST. - ERR Extension 'github.copilot-chat' wants API proposal 'languageModelDataPart@3' but that proposal DOES NOT EXIST. - ERR [GitHub.copilot-chat]: editor/context/chat is a proposed menu identifier. It requires 'package.json#enabledApiProposals: ["chatParticipantPrivate"]' and is only available when running out of dev or with the switch: --enable-proposed-api GitHub.copilot-chat Because those proposals aren’t available in OpenVSCode/BAS, tool registration fails: - ERR [GitHub.copilot-chat]: Tool set 'editFiles' CANNOT have an empty tools array (none of the tools were found) - Similar errors for 'runNotebooks', 'search', 'new' C) Store/registry noise (non-blocking) - Attempt to fetch Copilot extension metadata from Open VSX returns HTML (not JSON), causing: - Error while getting the latest version from open-vsx.org … Unexpected token '<' … (HTML page) **Artifacts I can provide** - Console log screenshots of the errors above. - Screenshot of openvscode-server version from Help → About, and vscode-copilot-chat version from the installed extensions. - HAR from the failing limited_user_signup preflight (redacted). - Copilot-chat logs file from console log. Thank you for any guidance on support stance or potential paths forward, Neta. [buildcode-extensions.cry10cf.int.applicationstudio.cloud.sap-copilot-chat.sap-175.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21914678/buildcode-extensions.cry10cf.int.applicationstudio.cloud.sap-copilot-chat.sap-175.zip) [buildcode-extensions.cry10cf.int.applicationstudio.cloud.sap.har.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/21914682/buildcode-extensions.cry10cf.int.applicationstudio.cloud.sap.har.zip)

title: Copilot Agent Cannot Maintain Context

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

body:
Type: Bug Bug Report: Copilot Agent Cannot Maintain Context No matter which model I choose — premium or standard — the behavior is the same: useless, on the level of < GPT-4.0 The core failure: it cannot hold context, even when explicitly told to. If I ask it to read a component and then its parent or child, it immediately drops the thread. It fabricates files or suggestions I never asked for. It contradicts itself within a few lines (“4 problems found” → “2 problems found” → “no problems found”). It even declares “build all clear” without verifying anything. This isn’t a subtle quirk — it’s a showstopper. The agent is not even trying to keep the scoped context it was given. I can’t overstate the frustration here. The tool is marketed as a coding assistant, but right now it feels like I’m babysitting a child that actively derails my workflow. This needs direct attention. title: Explorer does not refresh symbolic links even once direcotry deleted and refreshed

labels.name: *duplicate
labels.description: Issue identified as a duplicate of another issue(s)

body:
Type: Bug When working with javascript projects, it is common to have local references in the package.json dependencies section (such as "mypackage": "../mypackage") when doing a standard `npm i` this results in a Symbolic link being placed in the `node_modules` directory (denoted with a little arrow) However, if you update your module refernece (to say "mypackage": "^1.1.1") and then `rm -Rf node_modules` and `rm package-lock.json` then `npm i` Again ... the Symbolic link "Icon" remains in the node_modules folder. Note: the file on disk is a "checkout" of the NPM package (and not your local refernece). The FileSystem and NPM are "correct".... its just the Icon in the Explore view that is somehow "cached". minor issue, but it can cause temporary confusion. 1.Local VS Code, Windows 11 Pro Preview, with Developer Mode enabled
2.After setting up local Docker, even when Docker is closed, my network-connected VS Code has lost features like auto-indentation and line wrapping. For instance, when I type int main(void), press Enter to add {}, and then hit Enter inside those braces, the expected formatting doesn't happen—it behaves almost like editing a plain text file.
3.Unfortunately, reinstalling VS Code hasn't resolved the issue.

Thank you for taking the time to review this. I'm hoping to find a solution, as VS Code currently feels no different from a basic text editor without its usual auto-indentation and line-wrapping capabilities.

3. 即使重装也不好使。

感谢阅读，期待解决！

title: Creating Profiles from a Template or by Importing Gets Stuck

labels.name: *duplicate
labels.description: Issue identified as a duplicate of another issue(s)

body:
Type: Bug 1. Open Visual Studio Code. 2. Go to the Command Palette (Ctrl+Shift+P or F1). 3. Select “Profiles: Import Profile…” or “Profiles: Create Profile from Template…”. 4. Choose a .code-profile file or a built-in template. 5. VS Code begins installing extensions. 6. title: Copilot Incorrectly Renames Variables (Query Parameters) During Refactoring, Breaking API Interface
body:
Type: Bug Environment: Tool: GitHub Copilot Codebase: Python (backend), Dart/Flutter (frontend) Context: Legacy monolithic codebase being refactored into modules Description: I instructed Copilot to refactor a monolithic Python codebase into modular components. While the modularization was successful, Copilot unexpectedly renamed variables in the Python API from camelCase (e.g., myVar) to snake_case (e.g., my_var) to align with PEP 8 conventions. This change broke the API interface, as the frontend (Dart/Flutter) and other dependent systems expect the original variable names. I did not instruct Copilot to modify variable names, and preserving interface stability is critical for this legacy codebase. Steps to Reproduce: Provide Copilot with a monolithic Python codebase containing an API with camelCase variable names (e.g., myVar). Instruct Copilot to refactor the code into modules. Observe that Copilot renames variables to snake_case (e.g., my_var) without prompting for confirmation. Expected Behavior: Copilot should preserve existing variable names in API interfaces unless explicitly instructed to rename them. If Copilot intends to apply naming conventions (e.g., PEP 8), it should prompt the user for confirmation before making changes. Actual Behavior: Copilot automatically renamed variables from camelCase to snake_case, breaking the API interface and causing runtime errors in dependent systems. Impact: The unintended renaming broke compatibility with the frontend and other systems, requiring manual fixes. In legacy codebases, interface stability is critical, as changes can cause widespread issues. Standard practice is to deprecate old interfaces rather than modify them. Suggested Fix: Update Copilot to preserve existing variable names in API interfaces during refactoring unless explicitly instructed otherwise. Introduce a confirmation prompt before starting to ensure alignment with user intent. Additional Notes: The codebase is inherited, so maintaining existing interfaces is a priority. title: Enhance Todo list header with status icons and completion state
body:
Improves the Todo list widget header to display more contextual information by showing the current active task with status icons and a dedicated completion state.

## Changes

**Before**: Header showed active task format `"Task name (id/all)"` where task name was from the first in-progress or pending task.

**After**: Header shows enhanced format with visual indicators:
- **Active tasks**: `"🔵 Task name (id/all)"` with status icon (🔵 for in-progress, ⭕ for not-started)
- **All completed**: `"✅ Done (x/y)"` when no tasks are pending or in-progress
- **Empty state**: `"Todos"` when no tasks exist

## Examples

```
Before: "Write unit tests (2/3)"
After:  "🔵 Write unit tests (2/3)"

Before: "Set up database (1/2)" 
After:  "⭕ Set up database (1/2)"

Before: "No Active Tasks" (when all completed)
After:  "✅ Done (3/3)"
```

## Implementation

- Added status icons using existing codicon classes with proper color coding
- Enhanced `updateTitleElement()` to detect completion state and show "Done" format
- Maintains all existing widget functionality with proper icon alignment and localization support
- Uses the same visual language as the todo items themselves for consistency

This enhancement provides better visual context about task states and progress, making the Todo list header more informative at a glance.

<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT TIPS -->
---

💡 You can make Copilot smarter by setting up custom instructions, customizing its development environment and configuring Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. Learn more [Copilot coding agent tips](https://gh.io/copilot-coding-agent-tips) in the docs.

title: [FR] hi, support not wrap while the line is short & last \n char

labels.name: editor-wrapping
labels.description: Editor line wrapping issues

labels.name: under-discussion
labels.description: Issue is under discussion for relevance, priority, approach

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

```
"editor.wrapOnEscapedLineFeeds": true
```

1. If line is short, do not wrap (but now it wraps)

```c
printf("hello, this is short line~\nDO NOT wrap");
```


2. If line is long, give priority to breaking lines at \n

```c
printf("hello\n
    this is lonooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo
    OOOOOOOOOOOooooooooooG line~\n
    WRAP\n");
```

3. Also, do not wrap the last \n char
otherwise it will be 
```c
printf("hello\n
    this is lonooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo
    OOOOOOOOOOOooooooooooG line~\n
    WRAP\n
    ");
```
> Nobody will like this

title: Recently used repo feedback

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

I have many git repos open. I'm usually focused on a single one that might be in the middle of the list and it's hard to quickly find it to check/use it.

I propose the following:

After a git repo has been used, for instance after a commit->push, add some sort of activity/freshness feedback, maybe an icon, maybe temporary. To make it clear that it is a repo I have been using recently, and likely the one I want to use, instead of forcing users to read/parse/find the item in the column, which is not "instant".

title: Continue Prompts Waste Time

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

body:
Type: Bug Use AI to do anything that takes any time at all. The Prompt Will Eventually Come and Pause the Whole Point of AI and it will not do anything until you click something. This wastes so much time. It makes us have to babysit the AI, which defeats the whole point of it doing things for us because we have to use our time for it to do it. Also, while at it, there is also a prompt to run scripts. That is horrible. We should be able to tell the AI what to do and come back and have it done. It shouldn't take hours of our fime for days on end for it do something iterative. It should just do what we ask and we should only have to ask for it, not babysit it. There has never been one time when it was useful for a prompt to come up that delays the progress of the AI. However, there is a constant waste of my time or of the AI's time with prompts. Either I waste my time by having to click on them, or if I don't happen to notice, the AI pauses, which wastes the AI's time. This is RIDICULOUS. It defeats the point of AI if we have to do all its work for it. title: Custom Slash Commands
body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! feature_request_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
The Gemini CLI team created a file specification for custom slash commands, it would be great if vscode could also support these. 

A file at <project>/.gemini/commands/test.toml becomes the command /test.

Sub-directories are used to create namespaced commands, with the path separator (/ or \) being converted to a colon (:).

A file at <project>/.gemini/commands/git/commit.toml becomes the namespaced command /git:commit

The full toml format is on their blog here: 
[https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/developers-practitioners/gemini-cli-custom-slash-commands](https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/developers-practitioners/gemini-cli-custom-slash-commands)

body:
Type: Bug 1. Clone https://github.com/whatwg/html 2. Try editing the `source` file. (It may be required to set the syntax highlighting mode to HTML.) Actual results: ~0.5-1 second typing lag for each character. Expected results: still slower than Notepad, but usable. title: Use unattached chat editor for initial prompt
body:

ref https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/260221

When clicking the `+` to create a new coding agent session, this will lock the user into a new chat that is _not_ attached to a remote session but has the same visual elements as an attached chat.  After the first message, we forward to the extension and replace the active editor with the newly attached editor. This makes the GH coding agent flow we're looking for possible

title: Rendering of `View Pull Request Description` button in Chat Sessions view
body: As shown here, the `View Pull Request Description` button overlaps with the scrollbar (making it visually cutoff and only partially clickable):

title: Local chat session management in Chat Sessions view
body: I've been using Copilot (including local agent mode and remote coding agent sessions) quite a bit in my current repo. I just updated VS Code, and when I reopen the Chat Sessions view, I see an option to `Start a Chat` in the local chat sessions section: I'm a bit torn on this: - 👍 I like that I'm given an actionable button that draws my attention - ❔ I'm unclear why I need to start a chat, when I know I have a variety of chat sessions already on this repo When I click the `Start a Chat` button, I didn't expect a new chat editor to open: I already have a variety of local chat sessions in my history in this repo. If I open the secondary sidebar, I see this populated: What I expected / would want: - If I have existing local chat sessions in my history in this repo, I'd love to see them each listed in the Local Chat Sessions section - I shouldn't have to know to open the secondary sidebar to have a local chat session populated in the Local Chat Sessions section - I'd like to see all the same sessions I have in my local chat history listed here, rather than just the 1 open chat conversation - I'm accustomed to using the secondary sidebar for chat in this repo - Can / should we detect if a user has been using chat in the secondary sidebar already, and open a new local chat session there by default? - I know we now have the `...` where users can select where the session opens - can / should we provide that on the individual chat session level instead? Could we provide a setting where users may select a default value for all their chat sessions? -

title: Add support for Entra ID v1.0 authorization servers in VSCode MCP Client
body:
This PR adds comprehensive support for Microsoft Entra ID v1.0 authorization server endpoints in VSCode's MCP (Model Context Protocol) Client, addressing the limitation where only v2.0 endpoints were previously supported.

## Changes Made

### 1. Authorization Server Pattern Support
Added `https://login.microsoftonline.com/*` pattern to the Microsoft authentication provider configuration in:
- `extensions/microsoft-authentication/package.json` (`authorizationServerGlobs`)
- `extensions/microsoft-authentication/src/extensionV1.ts` (`supportedAuthorizationServers`)
- `extensions/microsoft-authentication/src/extensionV2.ts` (`supportedAuthorizationServers`)

### 2. Test Coverage
Added test case in `extensions/microsoft-authentication/src/common/test/scopeData.test.ts` to verify tenant extraction from v1.0 authorization server URLs.

## Supported Endpoints

**v1.0 Endpoints (newly supported):**
- `https://login.microsoftonline.com/common`
- `https://login.microsoftonline.com/organizations`
- `https://login.microsoftonline.com/consumers`
- `https://login.microsoftonline.com/{tenant-id}`

**v2.0 Endpoints (existing support maintained):**
- `https://login.microsoftonline.com/common/v2.0`
- `https://login.microsoftonline.com/organizations/v2.0`
- `https://login.microsoftonline.com/{tenant-id}/v2.0`

## Implementation Notes

The solution maintains a generic approach to OAuth discovery, using the standard RFC 8414 authorization server metadata discovery process for all providers. This ensures compatibility with v1.0 endpoints while preserving existing v2.0 functionality without provider-specific optimizations.

## Backward Compatibility

All changes maintain full backward compatibility. Existing v2.0 configurations continue to work unchanged while v1.0 endpoints are now supported through the standard discovery process.

Fixes #262602.
